features: 1-liter of Listerine Clinical Solutions Teeth Strength Anticavity Fluoride Mouthwash in a refreshing Alpine Mint flavor to repair tooth enamel, strengthen teeth & help prevent tooth decay

The fluoride mouthwash for adults repairs tooth enamel now for 24-hour cavity protection AND 3x stronger* & longer lasting teeth making it a great addition to your twice daily oral care routine *with brushing in a lab study

This mint mouthwash is powered by sodium fluoride and helps prevent tooth decay while helping to strengthen teeth. This mouthwash works below the tooth surface for 24-hour cavity protection** **when used twice daily

Adults & children 12 & older, use this oral rinse twice daily after brushing with toothpaste. Vigorously swish 10 mL of rinse between teeth for one minute & spit out. Do not swallow. Do not or eat or drink for 30 minutes after rinsing
Tested by dentists & hygienists, this ADA-Accepted mouth rinse from Listerine aids in the prevention of dental cavities while strengthening teeth & providing fresh breath for a refreshing mouth feel
body.description: Help strengthen teeth, fight cavities, & freshen breath in one step with Listerine Clinical Solutions Teeth Strength Anticavity Fluoride Mouthwash! This refreshing alpine mint-flavored fluoride mouthwash from Listerine, an ADA-Accepted mouthwash, is formulated with sodium fluoride to strengthen teeth and help prevent tooth decay. The oral rinse repairs tooth enamel now to prevent cavities & provide 3x stronger* & longer lasting teeth. Tested by dentists & dental hygienists, this mouthwash works below the tooth surface for 24-hour cavity protection** to improve & support your overall oral health. Adults & children 12 & older, use this mint oral rinse twice daily after brushing with toothpaste. Vigorously swish 10 mL of fluoride mouth rinse between teeth for one minute & then spit out; do not swallow the fluoride mouthwash. For best results, avoid eating or drinking for 30 minutes after rinsing. *with brushing in a lab study **when used twice daily

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 2, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Consistent Listerine quality
reviews.reviewText: Sort of hard to review this, but let me start with saying this is a true Listerine product, not a knock off. We ordered this primarily because we are senior citizens and try hard to continue to maintain the health of our teeth and mouth.We were intrigued with the idea that this mouthwash could help repair tooth enamel, strengthen teeth and prevent tooth decay. We are hoping this will be true and trust the Listerine brand to be more truthful than other off brands or imitations. We can not attest to whether or not this will accomplish what it is promoted to do.It does have a nice refreshing minty taste. We have a couple of travel sized bottles that we have refilled with this newer variety of Listerine that make it more accessible and convenient to use on a regular basis.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 9, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Fresh, minty (VERY MINTY!) tasting oral rinse.
reviews.reviewText: Listerine is a legacy brand we all grew up with. I typically purchase this brand at the supermarket but in zero alcohol formula. This formula however, has both alcohol and fluoride. Fluoride gets a bad rap lately, but I am no health expert so cannot accurately assess the validity of such regards. I'll use it anyway without concern for that. I will say this formula tastes MUCH stronger than what I'm accustomed to using and it's going to take some getting used to. Maybe I am overly sensitive to this formula. It doesn't have a lingering aftertaste, which I'll chalk up as a plus. Seems high quality as you'd expect from a trusted brand. You are getting a HUGE bottle here so you'll be set for quite a while. I'll say this is a good buy, especially if you're not concerned with the presence of fluoride and alcohol.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 7, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Amazing flavor, freshens breath and cleans teeth well!
reviews.reviewText: So happy I decided to try out this Listerine, it's now my new favorite. My go to usually is the original green Listerine, but this Alpine Mint flavor is amazing. It reminds me of a sweet mint chewing gum that I love, it's taste so good. It's more mild though, not as strong as the other Listerine mouthwash I've had before, but still noticeably minty. I use it two times a day and it freshens my breath right away. My teeth and gums feel much cleaner and my breath smells great! The bottle is huge and should last me awhile, since only a little bit is needed to get the job done. I'm very satisfied with it and will definitely be buying more once I'm out.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 12, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Nice flavor but there's no burn
reviews.reviewText: So as far as mouthwashes go, I never go a night without it. I prefer my mouthwash to cause immense pain in my mouth so I know it's working and this mouthwash doesn't do that. At all.The flavor and subtlety of this would be really good for kids or adults who don't appreciate the suffering but I think I'll go back to my other brand when this bottle is done.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 7, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars Not the Best Ingredients
reviews.reviewText: This mouth wash is advertised as repairing tooth enamel, which seems like false advertising to me. The active ingredient is fluoride which can help prevent cavities, but does not actively repair enamel. Most all mouth washes you see at the store have fluoride, so it doesn't really set this apart. A lot of products that try to be healthier for you also try to make a product that doesn't contain fluoride, but this does not fit that description.This mouthwash also contains alcohol. Many mouthwashes brag that they do not contain alcohol, and there is a reason for that. The alcohol in mouthwash kills bacteria in your mouth, which can be good for preventing cavities, but it also kills the good bacteria in your mouth that is helpful, leaving an environment that can be taken over by bad bacteria. So, this mouthwash fails in that regard too.Because this mouthwash is full of alcohol and fluoride, it can make some quick work out of freshening your breath, but I would not recommend making a habit out of using it often because the ingredients have been shown to do the opposite of create good oral health.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 4, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Doesn't burn like original Listerine
reviews.reviewText: It doesn't burn like the original Listerine. Does that mean it's better? It has Flouride like other mouthwashes and still has the ADA label, so it should be just as good as the original. The mint flavor is mild and pleasant, with no aftertaste. I would try to avoid drinking milk or coffee right after swishing, but still, no aftertaste. I could see switching to this rather than the blue version I usually choose.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 11, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Tastes like normal Listerine
reviews.reviewText: This tastes similar if not exact to the cool mint blue one that has been around for a long time. I really like that they added flouride because I have sensitive teeth so I find this really helpful in oral rinses. However, the alcohol really burns my mouth. I'm not a fan of that.I rated it 4 stars because it burns for me, but if you enjoy normal Listerine then this is probs a 5 stars for you.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 5, 2024
reviews.reviewText: I've been using Listerine for years and I have always liked the way it makes my mouth feel fresh and clean after brushing my teeth.This particular Alpine Mint flavor is very refreshing. It does seem to foam up a little more than the ol Cool Mint I've gotten for years. Other than that, its the same stuff I've used for a long time!
